note.p: Birth: Louvain, Belgium (21 August or 20 September 1813)

Career: Worked in Paris; Professor of Chemistry, Ecole Royale Militaire, Brussels (1840-1865); retired due to a speech impediment; worked at the Mint (to 1872); developed a method of detecting vegetable alkaloids (1850) which was later modified by Friedrich Julius Otto and known as the Stas-Otto method
Notes: DSB gives date of birth as 21 August 1813.
